title: My Pixel 3 doesn't support 5GHz WiFi
content:
Hello!
I live in Kazakhstan and my Pixel 3 does not see WiFi 5 GHz. This is because in the old base frequencies for 5 GHz were not available in our country. But in 2018 these frequencies were added.
Link to updated file https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/sforshee/wireless-regdb.git/tree/db.txt#n873
What to do in this situation?
How do I contact tech support to update the WiFi rules?

UPDATED
__________
Digging further about my problem, I found this document:
https://android.googlesource.com/kernel/common/+/android-trusty-3.10/Documentation/networking/regulatory.txt
It says that the CRDA data is taken from the repository that was last updated 6 years ago:
git: //git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/linville/wireless-regdb.git
Seriously?! It might be time to move to a more lively branch:
git: //git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/sforshee/wireless-regdb.git

How can I convey information to the developer?
